## n = 100

```{r}
n1 <- 100; (n1)
k <- 25
p <- 0.3
```

```{r}
mibinominal <- rbinom(n1,k,p)
```

```{r}
plot(mibinominal, col="pink",
main = "100 VA N(0,1)",
xlab ="VA generados",
ylab = "N(0,1)")

```

```{r}
hist(mibinominal, main="Histograma 100 VA N(0,1)",
     col="lightgreen",
     xlab="VA generadas",
     ylab="N(0,1)")

```

## COMPARACIOÃ“N DE GRAFICAS


# Valores de n
```{r}
n_values <- c(100, 500, 1000, 5000, 10000, 15000)
k <- 25
p <- 0.3


par(mfrow = c(2, 3))  # 2 filas, 3 columnas


for (n in n_values) {
  datos <- rbinom(n, k, p)
  hist(datos, main = paste("Histograma n =", n),
       col = "lightblue", xlab = "VA generadas", ylab = "Frecuencia")
}
```

# Valores de n y p
```{r}
n_values <- c(100, 500, 1000, 5000, 10000, 15000)
p_values <- c(0.3, 0.45, 0.8, 0.95)
k <- 25


par(mfrow = c(length(p_values), length(n_values)), mar = c(2,2,2,1))


for (p in p_values) {
  for (n in n_values) {
    datos <- rbinom(n, k, p)
    hist(datos, main = paste("n=", n, "\np=", p),
         col = "pink", xlab = "", ylab = "", cex.main = 0.8)
  }
}

```
